captions.text: Welcome to How To Cook That I am Ann Reardon

Today we are making gooey peanut butter and
chocolate brownies.

If you are after a cakey brownie check out
the food fight video after this one, but if

you want a rich and gooey brownie then you're
in the right place.

Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Farrenheit
or 180 Celcius

To make our bottom chocolate layer you will
need some flour, sugar, butter or margarine,

chocolate, eggs and vanilla.
Place the chocolate and butter into a bowl
and melt that in the microwave.

All of the recipe quantities are listed on
the website howtocookthat.net in grams and

ounces and cups I'll put a link in the description
below this video.

Stir to combine and then add your sugar and
mix that through.
Then whisk in the eggs followed by the vanilla.

Next pour in the flour and mix until just
combined. Line a brownie tin with non-stick

baking paper, I like to have the sides of
the paper higher than the tin for this one
because we are making a double layer brownie.

Pour the chocolate brownie mixture into the
tin and then we want to bake that in the oven
for around 10 minutes.

While that is baking microwave the butter,
white chocolate and peanut butter in a bowl

and stir it to combine.
Add the sugar and mix in, then whisk in the

eggs this is just like we did for the chocolate
brownie layer. And finally stir in the flour
until just combined.

Your chocolate layer should have set slightly
on the top but it's not cooked all the way

through yet. Pour the white chocolate and
peanut butter brownie layer over the top.
And place that back in the oven for 35 minutes.

Remove it from the oven and leave in the tin
to cool.

Then lift the paper out of the tin and slice
up your browie.

To serve stack two brownies on top of each
other add a scoop of ice cream and pour over
some warm chocolate ganache.

Then enjoy some gooey chocolate peanut butter
heaven.
Click on the links below to share this video,

Subscribe to How To Cook That for more desserts,
cakes and chocolate.

Click here to go to the How To Cook That youtube
channel and check out all the other creations

and that cakey brownie recipe.
This one will take you to last weeks chocolate

candle video.
Or click here to go to the website and get
the recipe.

I'll add all of those links in the description
below as well.
Have a great week and I'll see you Friday

title: Gooey Chocolate Peanut Butter Brownies Recipe HOW TO COOK THAT Ann Reardon
